Through original programming, documentaries, and expert-led discussions, MHTN aims to increase awareness, provide valuable information, and encourage open conversations about mental well-being.

programme.title: Quo Vadis TV
programme.desc: Quo Vadis TV is committed to sharing the Biblical message in a way that makes Christian living practical, realistic, and attainable. Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

programme.title: Crush With Lee & Tiffany
programme.desc: "Crush With Lee & Tiffany" stars outdoor enthusiasts Lee and Tiffany Lakosky, a husband/wife team whose partnership begins in the home and extends to the woods of eastern Iowa and beyond. They love to bowhunt, and when they are not in New Mexico tracking elk or in North Carolina chasing turkeys -- among other travels -- they fulfill their passion for the sport on their Iowa farm, where they practice a strict land-management program for world-class white-tailed deer. "Let them go, let them grow," is a phrase the couple favors, but when the time comes to cull the herd, Lee and Tiffany demonstrate an uncanny ability to get the job done.

programme.title: Think Big
programme.desc: Children are the future -- and so are their inventions, which is why "Think Big" could be an important show. It features young inventors competing to see who can come up with the most-innovative invention. Each episode features two teams in the Think Tank -- a studio filled with art supplies and construction materials -- who brainstorm and choose materials before sketching, designing and building a prototype to be presented to a judge, who determines a winner. The champions earn bragging rights and the coveted Genius Cup.

programme.title: America's Heartland
programme.desc: Much of the food Americans eat is produced by farmers and ranchers in the country's heartland, but many people don't know how it's produced. "America's Heartland" provides information about the people and processes responsible for the availability of food and fuel across the country and around the world. The show's reporters and producers tell stories in topics that include farm families, consumer issues, animal welfare and crop sustainability. Some episodes also take the show abroad to countries such as Egypt and Taiwan to show the impact American agriculture has on the global economy.

programme.title: Sagebrush Trail
programme.desc: Wrongly imprisoned for murder, John Brant (John Wayne) decides his only option is to escape from jail and clear his name by finding the true killer. After breaking out, he ends up on the run from Sheriff Parker (Bob Burns) and catches the attention of outlaw Bob Jones (Lane Chandler), who offers to let Brant into his gang. Needing all the help he can get, Brant agrees, but running with these bandits only gets him deeper into trouble -- while the real killer remains on the loose.

programme.title: West of the Divide
programme.desc: Cowpoke Ted Hayden (John Wayne) infiltrates a band of outlaws in order to get close to their ringleader, Mr. Gentry (Lloyd Whitlock) -- the man who murdered his father. Joining Hayden on his mission is his dim but devoted companion, Dusty (George "Gabby" Hayes). But their plan gets complicated when Hayden meets Fay (Virginia Brown Faire), the lovely daughter of rancher Fred Winters (Lafe McKee). Gentry is after the man's land, and he wants Hayden to kill him to get it.

Paid Programming: Carshield -- Cars Have Changed
Back Street
programme.desc: Fannie Hurst's best seller of a married man and his mistress who foster a passionate affair for over 20 years.

programme.title: Roman Holiday
programme.desc: Overwhelmed by her suffocating schedule, touring European princess Ann (Audrey Hepburn) takes off for a night while in Rome. When a sedative she took from her doctor kicks in, however, she falls asleep on a park bench and is found by an American reporter, Joe Bradley (Gregory Peck),who takes her back to his apartment for safety. At work the next morning, Joe finds out Ann's regal identity and bets his editor he can get exclusive interview with her, but romance soon gets in the way.

programme.title: The Hawk of Wild River
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) has himself thrown in jail to trick an outlaw known as the Hawk (Clayton Moore) and bring him and his entire gang to justice.

programme.title: Raton Pass
programme.desc: Homesteaders help a husband (Dennis Morgan) fight his wife (Patricia Neal) and her gunman (Steve Cochran) for their New Mexico ranch.

programme.title: Rails Into Laramie
programme.desc: The railroad sends an agent to a western town to try to find out who is behind the efforts to stop the railroad from building its line into the area.

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: While being escorted to jail, bank robber Jim Larson (Fred MacMurray) manages to get the upper hand on his captor and escape. Jim is surprised to see his brother appear on the scene, ready to aid his sibling. As they make their getaway, his brother and the pursuing lawman shoot each other, leaving the stunned Jim alone and on the run. Assuming a different identity, Jim travels to a mining town and befriends the local sheriff (Lin McCarthy), hoping to start over and find redemption.

programme.title: An Affair to Remember
programme.desc: A man and a woman have a romance while on a cruise from Europe to New York. Despite being engaged to other people, both agree to reunite at the top of the Empire State Building in six months. However, an unfortunate accident keeps her from the reunion, and he fears that she has married or does not love him anymore.

programme.title: The Valley of Decision
programme.desc: An Irish maid, Mary Rafferty (Greer Garson), falls for Paul (Gregory Peck), who is the son of her rich boss, William Scott (Donald Crisp). To further complicate matters, Mary's father, Pat (Lionel Barrymore), lost both of his legs in an accident at the steel mill owned by Paul's father. Neither William nor Pat approves of the couple's romance, and the burgeoning relationship only becomes a bigger battleground when a strike erupts at the steel mill.

programme.title: Raton Pass
programme.desc: Homesteaders help a husband (Dennis Morgan) fight his wife (Patricia Neal) and her gunman (Steve Cochran) for their New Mexico ranch.

programme.title: Sagebrush Trail
programme.desc: Wrongly imprisoned for murder, John Brant (John Wayne) decides his only option is to escape from jail and clear his name by finding the true killer. After breaking out, he ends up on the run from Sheriff Parker (Bob Burns) and catches the attention of outlaw Bob Jones (Lane Chandler), who offers to let Brant into his gang. Needing all the help he can get, Brant agrees, but running with these bandits only gets him deeper into trouble -- while the real killer remains on the loose.

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Holmes takes a holiday in Cornwall's countryside, only to have his healthy routine interrupted by something that happened during the night.

programme.title: H2O Mop X5
programme.desc: Clean and Sanitize With Steam Power.

programme.title: Stranger on Horseback
programme.desc: A circuit judge (Joel McCrea) rides in to break a ruthless cattle baron's stranglehold on a frontier town.

programme.title: Through the Bible With Les Feldick
programme.desc: Les Feldick, an Oklahoma farmer and rancher with a special gift for teaching the Bible; his simple and nondenominational approach on the program "Through the Bible with Les Feldick" has reached millions around the world with the Gospel of Grace.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Bat falls for a woman not knowing her involvement in a mob headed for Wyoming; Earp chases after him, following the trail of stolen cattle and dead lawmen the mob leaves in its wake.

programme.title: The Valley of Decision
programme.desc: An Irish maid, Mary Rafferty (Greer Garson), falls for Paul (Gregory Peck), who is the son of her rich boss, William Scott (Donald Crisp). To further complicate matters, Mary's father, Pat (Lionel Barrymore), lost both of his legs in an accident at the steel mill owned by Paul's father. Neither William nor Pat approves of the couple's romance, and the burgeoning relationship only becomes a bigger battleground when a strike erupts at the steel mill.

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: The conniving Ed Barker (Dick Curtis) murders a rancher and tries to steal the ranch from his widow, Jean Andrews (Ann Doran). However, their old friend Cliff Houston (Charles Starrett) appears on the scene to try and save the day. He makes a deal with Barker and his crew to drive the Andrews herd to market and split the money, but each man really plans to con the other as soon as the time is right. Along for the ride is singing cowboy Bob Stevens (Bob Nolan).

programme.title: The Gun Hawk
programme.desc: When his town-drunk father is killed by the Sully brothers, gunfighter Blaine Madden exacts his revenge but flees when the sheriff tries to arrest him.

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: While being escorted to jail, bank robber Jim Larson (Fred MacMurray) manages to get the upper hand on his captor and escape. Jim is surprised to see his brother appear on the scene, ready to aid his sibling. As they make their getaway, his brother and the pursuing lawman shoot each other, leaving the stunned Jim alone and on the run. Assuming a different identity, Jim travels to a mining town and befriends the local sheriff (Lin McCarthy), hoping to start over and find redemption.

programme.title: Return to Warbow
programme.desc: Three escaped convicts return to collect the money that the brother of one of them has already spent.

programme.title: The Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Washed-up film director Harry Dawes (Humphrey Bogart) gets a second chance at stardom when he discovers stunning peasant Maria Vargas (Ava Gardner) dancing in a nightclub in Madrid, Spain. Goaded by his producer, strong-arming Wall Street financier Kirk Edwards (Warren Stevens), Harry convinces her to screen test for, and then star in, his next big picture. But as Edwards' possessive nature and the realities of stardom weigh on Maria, she seeks a genuine lover with whom she can escape.

programme.title: The Great Gatsby
programme.desc: Nick Carraway (Sam Waterston) is a young man from the Midwest living modestly among the decadent mansions of 1920s Long Island. He becomes involved in the life of the mysterious Jay Gatsby (Robert Redford), a rich man who throws the most lavish parties on the island. But behind Gatsby's outgoing demeanor is a lonely man who wants nothing more than to be with his old love, Daisy (Mia Farrow). She is married to the bullheaded Tom (Bruce Dern), creating a love triangle that will end in tragedy.

programme.title: The Gay Cavalier
programme.desc: The Cisco Kid (Gilbert Roland) and Pancho (Martin Garralaga) try to help an unhappy bride.

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Holmes investigates when a prize race horse disappears and its trainer dies unnaturally.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Upon learning that a reputed stagecoach driver feels nervous about his final route before retirement, Earp offers to accompany him and sets up protective measures along the route to keep them out of danger.

programme.title: Rimfire
programme.desc: An undercover Army captain (James Millican) links missing gold and murder to a gambler's (Reed Hadley) ghost.

programme.desc: Les Feldick, an Oklahoma farmer and rancher with a special gift for teaching the Bible; his simple and nondenominational approach on the program "Through the Bible with Les Feldick" has reached millions around the world with the Gospel of Grace.

programme.title: Return to Warbow
programme.desc: Three escaped convicts return to collect the money that the brother of one of them has already spent.

programme.title: The Far Country
programme.desc: At the height of the Yukon Gold Rush, cowboy Jeff Webster (James Stewart) and his partner, Ben Tatum (Walter Brennan), want in on the action, and decide to drive their cattle from Wyoming to Yukon. Along their journey, the two run afoul of crooked lawman Gannon (John McIntire), who vows revenge when they escape him. After traveling through all manner of terrain, Webster and Tatum finally arrive at their destination. But Gannon has business in the town, and he intends to make good on his promise.

programme.title: Chisum
programme.desc: Kind-hearted, fatherly John Chisum (John Wayne) owns a large ranch in Lincoln County, New Mexico, in the 1870s. With the help of his faithful sidekick, Pepper (Ben Johnson), and a hot-headed young ranch hand nicknamed Billy the Kid (Geoffrey Deuel), Chisum does battle with underhanded land developer Lawrence Murphy (Forrest Tucker). Having bought up most of the nearby town and appointed his own corrupt sheriff (Bruce Cabot), Murphy now has his eye on Chisum's ranch.

programme.title: The Rainmaker
programme.desc: During the Great Depression, a drought is wreaking havoc on a small, destitute Kansas town. Bill Starbuck (Burt Lancaster), a slick grifter, arrives in town, promising he can make it rain in exchange for $100. His offer is accepted by H. C. Curry (Cameron Prudhomme), a rancher whose spinster daughter, Lizzie (Katharine Hepburn), is desperate for a suitor. Lizzie finally finds confidence when Starbuck, ever the smooth talker, convinces her she's beautiful.

programme.title: Jet Pilot
programme.desc: During the Cold War, a Russian jet enters airspace over Alaska and is escorted to an American air base. The pilot, Anna Marladovna (Janet Leigh) demands asylum but refuses to provide information on Soviet activities. Col. Jim Shannon (John Wayne) receives orders to befriend Anna in order to win her confidence and gather information. The pilots compete with each other but gradually fall in love. When it appears Anna may be deported, Jim marries her -- only to discover that she may be a spy.

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A murder investigation leads Holmes and Watson on a wild goose chase.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Earp attempts to free an adopted woman from an abusive family but meets resistance at every turn; with Dodge City officials refusing to help, Earp must resort to finding a cowhand to wed her -- or marry the woman himself.

programme.title: Saddles and Sagebrush
programme.desc: A rancher (Russell Hayden) joins an outlaw gang to figure out how to stop it.

programme.title: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
programme.desc: Questions arise when Senator Stoddard (James Stewart) attends the funeral of a local man named Tom Doniphon (John Wayne) in a small Western town. Flashing back, we learn Doniphon saved Stoddard, then a lawyer, when he was roughed up by a crew of outlaws terrorizing the town, led by Liberty Valance (Lee Marvin). As the territory's safety hung in the balance, Doniphon and Stoddard, two of the only people standing up to him, proved to be very important, but different, foes to Valance.

programme.title: El Dorado
programme.desc: Heartless tycoon Bart Jason (Edward Asner) hires a group of thugs to force the MacDonald family out of El Dorado so he can claim their land. J.P. Harrah, the town's sheriff, is too deep in the throes of alcoholism to help the family. When Harrah's friend, noble elder gunfighter Cole Thorton (John Wayne), learns of the predicament, he travels to El Dorado with his upstart friend, Mississippi (James Caan), to help Harrah clean up in time for a shootout against Jason's men.

programme.title: Jet Pilot
programme.desc: During the Cold War, a Russian jet enters airspace over Alaska and is escorted to an American air base. The pilot, Anna Marladovna (Janet Leigh) demands asylum but refuses to provide information on Soviet activities. Col. Jim Shannon (John Wayne) receives orders to befriend Anna in order to win her confidence and gather information. The pilots compete with each other but gradually fall in love. When it appears Anna may be deported, Jim marries her -- only to discover that she may be a spy.

programme.title: The Man From the Alamo
programme.desc: As the Texan militia inside the Alamo braces for Gen. Santa Anna's attack, soldier John Stroud (Glenn Ford) is chosen to go to the nearby town of Ox Bow to warn the women and children. He arrives to the scene of a massacre, with his wife and young son among the victims, perpetrated by a gang of Texans fighting for the Mexican side and led by the outlaw Jess Wade (Victor Jory). Branded a deserter for having left the Alamo before its fall, Stroud infiltrates Wade's gang to extract his revenge.

programme.title: Coroner Creek
programme.desc: A gunfighter (Randolph Scott) loses his beloved in a robbery and hunts the man (George Macready) to blame, who is living off the loot.

programme.title: The Taming of the West
programme.desc: A new lawman (Bill Elliott) punches out cattle rustlers who like to shoot sheriffs.

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Holmes investigates a death and the disappearance of plans for a secret submarine.

programme.title: Bells of Rosarita
programme.desc: Shortly after circus owner Sue Farnum (Dale Evans), her assistant, Gabby (George "Gabby" Hayes), and her late father's ex-partner, Slim Phillips (Addison Richards), accidentally interrupt the filming of a movie starring singing cowboy Roy Rogers (Roy Rogers), Slim is kidnapped. Sue suspects that William Ripley (Grant Withers), a crooked businessman who's trying to steal her circus, is behind the kidnapping. While Sue and Gabby set up a special performance, Roy tracks Slim's kidnappers.

programme.title: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
programme.desc: Questions arise when Senator Stoddard (James Stewart) attends the funeral of a local man named Tom Doniphon (John Wayne) in a small Western town. Flashing back, we learn Doniphon saved Stoddard, then a lawyer, when he was roughed up by a crew of outlaws terrorizing the town, led by Liberty Valance (Lee Marvin). As the territory's safety hung in the balance, Doniphon and Stoddard, two of the only people standing up to him, proved to be very important, but different, foes to Valance.

programme.title: El Dorado
programme.desc: Heartless tycoon Bart Jason (Edward Asner) hires a group of thugs to force the MacDonald family out of El Dorado so he can claim their land. J.P. Harrah, the town's sheriff, is too deep in the throes of alcoholism to help the family. When Harrah's friend, noble elder gunfighter Cole Thorton (John Wayne), learns of the predicament, he travels to El Dorado with his upstart friend, Mississippi (James Caan), to help Harrah clean up in time for a shootout against Jason's men.

programme.title: Massacre River
programme.desc: Two Army officers (Guy Madison, Rory Calhoun) love the colonel's daughter and face Indians.

programme.title: Back Street
programme.desc: Fannie Hurst's best seller of a married man and his mistress who foster a passionate affair for over 20 years.

programme.title: Top Secret Affair
programme.desc: A publisher (Susan Hayward) uses her magazine and charm to derail a general (Kirk Douglas) on the Washington fast track.

programme.title: Indiscreet
programme.desc: Famous theater actress Anna Kalman (Ingrid Bergman) has resigned herself to her single life, believing that she has missed her chance at meeting a husband. Weary of socializing in Europe, she returns to her London flat, where her sister Margaret (Phyllis Calvert) and diplomat brother-in-law Alfred (Cecil Parker) invite her to a banquet. She demurs until Alfred's banker friend, Philip Adams (Cary Grant), arrives and a flirtation begins. Their romance blossoms -- but he's already married.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E1 The Long Rope Cheyenne returns to his hometown as Sheriff Bodie. He is seeking a murderer in a town filled with corruption. Being home brings back many memories, including an old feud and a man who organized a lynching when he was a child.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E12 Feet of Clay Little Billy Allen's mother has died so he waits for his father at the Cartwrights. Unknown to Billy, his father is a prisoner who has broken out of jail. When the father commits robbery and murder, Hoss is forced to kill him.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E35 Blood Brothers Lucas finds a wounded man, takes him to the North Fork doctor, and gives blood to help save the stranger's life. Marshal Torrance won't help as he says he knows the man and wants him dead. Things become more complicated when vigilantes ride to town.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E36 Stranger at Night Coming home from school, Mark stumbles upon a dead man's body. Lucas discovers he was stabbed and the only clue is a belt with the initials R.M. Lucas leaves Mark with Artemus Quarles, a cousin who is visiting. Quarles, however, is not who he seems.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E37 The Raid A renegade Apache named Chaqua raids the McCain Ranch and kidnaps Mark. Lucas gathers a group of men to get Mark back, but Chaqua plans to make him an Apache warrior since he lost his own son. Lucas will stop at nothing to get his son back to safety.

programme.title: Outlaw's Inheritance
programme.desc: The townspeople of North Fork begin to get suspicious when Lucas is named as the beneficiary in the will of an infamous outlaw.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E3 Midnight Cowboys In the middle of the night, a group of wayward yearlings ends up on a city baseball field, and the county sheriff asks the guys to help get them roped. Bubba's father-in-law offers him an office job, but taking the position would require him to leave the ranch in Alabama and move to neighboring Mississippi. Cody worries that he is running out of room for his growing family, forcing him to consider a new house. And, Booger gives a few lessons to a young boy who wants to learn about the cowboy way of life.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E4 The Friend Zone A shipment from Faith Cattle Company is in jeopardy when the truck gets stuck in a ditch. It's a race against the clock to get the cattle to the buyer or risk losing the deal. Bubba teams up with his father-in-law to build a custom grill prototype in hopes of launching a new business venture. Cody decides to sell a horse to help fund his dream home, but he receives an offer that is less than ideal. After getting relationship advice from Bubba and Cody, Booger ends up on a date with his best friend Ashley.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E22 Heller A teenage girl named Heller and her brother are abused by her drunken stepfather. The town becomes aware after Heller is caught stealing from the general store. The children plan the drunk's demise as the cruelty continues. Lucas steps in to help.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E23 The Grasshopper When Lucas and Mark go on a train trip, clouds of swarming grasshoppers force the train to stop. A prisoner takes advantage of the emergency and breaks free, then kills Marshal Dixon. Lucas, with the help of a buffalo hunter, outwits the outlaw.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S1 E8 Old Ironpants Captain Parmenter goes away for two weeks of command school training. Upon his return, he is a changed man, no longer the usual easygoing commander. Now ruling with an iron fist, he is a fierce disciplinarian, which no one in the F Troop likes.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S1 E9 Me Heap Big Injun Since Corporal Agarn's enlistment is almost up, he decides to leave the army instead of reenlisting. He joins the Hekawi Tribe to become a brave and help with the manufacturing of Indian curios. Turns out, he's better than the braves in the tribe.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E6 Black Bart's Revenge Wells Fargo detective James Hume hires private investigator Harry Morse to join the hunt for Black Bart. Known as the Poet Highwayman, Bart leaves tantalizing poems at the scenes of his crimes, which may be the key to unmasking Bart's true identity.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E7 Elijah Briant and the Wild Bunch When Elijah Briant is elected sheriff, the mild-mannered druggist and former teacher tries to enforce the law without carrying a weapon. But he soon faces his greatest challenge when the last surviving members of the Wild Bunch descend on his town.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E7 George Croghan: Frontier Peacemaker When Chief Pontiac organizes a coalition of Native American tribes to attack British forts, frontier trader George Croghan risks his life on a perilous journey into the wilderness to find Pontiac, negotiate a peace agreement, and prevent all-out war.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E14 Shadowmen A Pinkerton agent comes to Rock Creek in search of a bank robber. Meanwhile, Teaspoon befriends Marie, who claims to be destitute, but Bill and Jesse discover that she is part of an outlaw gang.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E2 Counterfeit Gun Cheyenne is guarding a gold shipment on a train. A gang robs the train and shoots a man dead. Before he passes away, the man names Cheyenne as the gang's leader. Cheyenne must clear his name.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E3 Road to Three Graves Cheyenne helps his friend Tuk deliver equipment across private property to a mine. However, they run into major problems when they encounter a detestable landowner who wants the equipment for himself.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E13 Death at Dawn When a member of a powerful gang of outlaws murders a local shopkeeper, the killer is sentenced to be hanged. The leader of the gang kidnaps Ben and holds him hostage in an attempt to gain the killer's freedom.

programme.desc: S1 E38 Boomerang Sam Elder unexpectedly dies after the bank forecloses on his ranch Lucas takes in his son, who is now orphaned. Lucas teaches the boy how to use a gun, but Lucas doesn't know the boy plans to get revenge on the banker.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E39 The Mind Reader Rancher John Hallager is shot and killed in North Fork and young Billy Mathis is a prime suspect. Billy was seeing Hallager's daughter but was told to stay away. Lucas believes in Billy's innocence, and a clue may help.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E1 The Patsy Sully Hobbs and his outlaw gang ride to North Fork intent on taking over the town. They must first get rid of Lucas McCain without involving themselves. To do so, the gang forces the barber to fight Lucas, but Lucas suspects something is amiss.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E2 Bloodlines The North Fork Saloon is ransacked by the Malakie brothers, who are three rough mountain men. A fight breaks out and one brother is killed. Lucas is blamed and when their father arrives, he vows vengeance.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E3 Midnight Cowboys In the middle of the night, a group of wayward yearlings ends up on a city baseball field, and the county sheriff asks the guys to help get them roped. Bubba's father-in-law offers him an office job, but taking the position would require him to leave the ranch in Alabama and move to neighboring Mississippi. Cody worries that he is running out of room for his growing family, forcing him to consider a new house. And, Booger gives a few lessons to a young boy who wants to learn about the cowboy way of life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E1 The Patsy Sully Hobbs and his outlaw gang ride to North Fork intent on taking over the town. They must first get rid of Lucas McCain without involving themselves. To do so, the gang forces the barber to fight Lucas, but Lucas suspects something is amiss.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E2 Bloodlines The North Fork Saloon is ransacked by the Malakie brothers, who are three rough mountain men. A fight breaks out and one brother is killed. Lucas is blamed and when their father arrives, he vows vengeance.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E5 Is It a Boy or a Girl? Before heading out for the day's work, Bubba notices one of his colts is missing, and the guys go searching for the young horse before it is injured. At the urging of his grandmother, Booger ventures into the world of Internet dating, hoping to find a serious girlfriend. After Bubba's trusted horse gets sick, he asks Booger to help him break in a new colt. Cody and Misty finally find out if they are having a little cowboy or cowgirl, and they plan a party to reveal the gender to friends and family.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E6 Misty Makes a Match The cowboys are in for a busy week when they're called upon to capture a wild hog that has been getting into a neighbor's garden. They also search a swamp for a calf that goes missing when they move their herd. Cody and Misty get serious about finding a name for their baby boy, so they study their family trees for inspiration. After a disastrous attempt at Internet dating, Booger takes one more shot at dating and agrees to go on a blind date that Misty arranges. Will he finally find a woman that understands the cowboy way of life?

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E24 A Time for Singing Outlaws kill a preacher and his wife. Two members of the group assume their identity and come to North Fork to rob the bank. However, when Mark finds out who they really are, he is kidnapped and kept quiet. Lucas and Micah set out to stop the gang.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E25 The Deserter A wounded Army deserter shows up at the McCain Ranch desperate for a horse. Lucas takes him in just as the Army Cavalry unit appears to take the deserter into custody. In town, the harsh commanding officer demands he be executed for desertion.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S1 E10 She's Only a Build in a Girdled Cage Dobbs' mother arrives for a surprise visit to Fort Courage. However, almost immediately upon arrival, she is accidentally mistaken by a confused O'Rourke and F Troop for Laura Lee, a dance hall singer who is there to entertain the men.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S1 E11 A Gift from the Chief After Captain Wilton Parmenter accidentally saves Chief Wild Eagle's life, he is given the surprising, unusual gift of an Indian baby as a reward. Parmenter, known for his awkwardness, now faces the unexpected responsibility of caring for an infant.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E8 El Bandito Vasquez When an elusive bandito terrorizes early Los Angeles County, an eager reporter shadows the sheriff who is hunting the dangerous outlaw. Will the reporter stay objective or take matters into his own hands when he comes face to face with the killer?

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E3 Bronco Bill's Treasure When Bronco Bill and his gang are robbing trains at will, two veteran lawmen join forces to stop the violent outlaws once and for all. Years later, gunfighter-turned-reporter Bat Masterson hears the story from the last surviving member of the gang.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E5 James Harrod: Kentucky's Founding Father When frontiersman James Harrod founds Harrod's Town on Native American hunting grounds in Kentucky, he soon finds his new settlement under attack. His leadership is tested as he defends the first European settlement west of the Appalachian Mountains.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E15 Mask of Fear After serving his time in prison, a murderer returns to Rock Creek. Meanwhile, Jesse has a new boss in Fury, who he looks up to as a father figure. But, the murder of his boss leads Jesse and the townspeople quick to blame the town's new arrival.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E4 Two Trails to Santa Fe Cheyenne helps an Apache woman escape torture from her tribe. He transports her to Santa Fe. However, angry Apaches retaliate and attack a settlement. The pair also encounters gold-hungry prospectors along the way.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E5 Savage Breed Cheyenne is guiding a buffalo hunting party that Marshal Lestrade is leading. Lestrade's daughter Lily and Senator Carr are in the group. Cheyenne finds a herd, but a mysterious gunshot sends the buffalo on a stampede. Cheyenne is suspicious.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S2 E1 Showdown A young bank robber decides to get a job at the Ponderosa with the Cartwrights in an attempt to prevent the local sheriff from learning the whereabouts of his accomplices, known as the feared Pardo gang.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E3 The Blowout Al Walker, a sick gunslinger, comes to North Fork hoping to die in peace. Knowing that his presence will attract outlaws, Micah and Lucas put him in protective custody. When outlaws set fire to the town, Walker dies a hero by standing up to them.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E4 Obituary Newspaperman Byron Claremont writes an article about old gunslinger, Ben Russell, who settled down years ago. The article brings in a young gun, who murders Russell. Next, Claremont writes about Lucas McCain and his rifle, which brings more tragedy.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E5 Tension Lucas and Mark help Sid Halpern with his cattle drive. When bounty hunter Clemmie Martin confronts Halpern and gunfire erupts, Halpern and Martin both perish. Lucas tries to hide Halpern's criminal past from his widow and son.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E6 Eddie's Daughter Eddie Halstead is a hotel clerk in North Fork. His daughter, Lillian, who he hasn't seen since childhood, arrives in town. She is now a dance hall girl and Lucas discovers criminals are following her, focused on the stolen money in her possession.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E4 Obituary Newspaperman Byron Claremont writes an article about old gunslinger, Ben Russell, who settled down years ago. The article brings in a young gun, who murders Russell. Next, Claremont writes about Lucas McCain and his rifle, which brings more tragedy.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E5 Tension Lucas and Mark help Sid Halpern with his cattle drive. When bounty hunter Clemmie Martin confronts Halpern and gunfire erupts, Halpern and Martin both perish. Lucas tries to hide Halpern's criminal past from his widow and son.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E6 Eddie's Daughter Eddie Halstead is a hotel clerk in North Fork. His daughter, Lillian, who he hasn't seen since childhood, arrives in town. She is now a dance hall girl and Lucas discovers criminals are following her, focused on the stolen money in her possession.

programme.title: The Gun and the Pulpit
programme.desc: The captivating tale of a smooth-talking gunslinger posing as a preacher to hide from his enemies. He ends up bringing hope to his parishioners and law-and-order to a town terrorized by crooks.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E7 Wild Bill Hickok & the First Quick-Draw Duel Wild Bill Hickok and his buddy, Davis Tutt, see their friendship fall apart over gambling debts and the affections of a beautiful woman. After Tutt swipes Wild Bill's prized timepiece as payback for a disputed debt, things begin to heat up. Then, when Tutt parades through town with the watch in one hand and Hickok's former girlfriend in the other, Wild Bill's blood begins to boil. Tutt refuses to return the watch, and he continues to flaunt the beautiful woman on his arm. The two men meet in the middle of town to settle their differences once and for all in what will become the very first quick-draw duel of the Old West. Both men reach for their pistols at the same time and fire! In an attempt to separate the truth from the fiction, Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman, interviews George Ward Nichols, the journalist who immortalized the duel and created the legend of Wild Bill Hickok.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E26 The Vision Mark drinks some tainted water from a barrel and contracts typhoid fever. Lucas is forced to use an eccentric old doctor. During bouts of a continuous intense fever, Mark becomes delirious and has a vision of his deceased mother, who he never knew.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E27 The Lariat Lariat Jones, an old friend of Lucas', comes to North Fork to open up a new gambling casino. Jones has an excellent reputation as an honest gambler. But when two strangers become his partners, accusations of cheating become deadly for Jones.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E3 The Fossil Feud When bloodthirsty Canadian trappers try to kill him, mountain man Jim Bridger takes cover in an unexplored valley. There, he runs headlong into a family of escaped slaves who show him the huge footprints and fossilized bones of long-dead monsters.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E8 The Snakeroot Cure When a young girl is bitten by a rattlesnake, mountain man Jim Bridger finds himself in a race against time to save her arm and keep her alive as he desperately searches the wilderness for a medicinal plant that once saved the life of his friend.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E4 Ada Curnutt, U.S. Deputy Marshal After being sworn in as one of Oklahoma's first female deputy marshals, Ada Curnutt volunteers to track down two killers-turned-counterfeiters and concocts a cunning plan to bring them to justice without using a gun.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E2 Bass Reeves: A Father's Justice After a man murders his wife in a jealous rage and goes on the run, local lawmen are stunned when legendary Marshal Bass Reeves accepts responsibility for bringing the killer to justice...because the murderer is none other than Reeves' own son.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E4 Mason & Dixon: Trailblazing Surveyors English astronomers Charles Mason and Jeremiah Dixon brave deadly terrain and hostile Native Americans to resolve a border dispute in Colonial America. With science and courage, they survey their famous Mason-Dixon Line with pinpoint accuracy.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E17 The Road Not Taken Jimmy is hot on the trail of a killer that he has personal reasons for taking down. Jesse decides to tag along. Meanwhile, back at the station, the other riders are upset with Cody about a published story he wrote about them.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S2 E3 Badge Without Honor Gerald Eskith comes to town claiming to be a deputy marshal. He plans to take the Cartwrights' friend, Jason Blaine, to San Francisco to testify against the Murdock gang. Adam is suspicious and goes along with them.

programme.title: Shoot Out
programme.desc: A former robber is released from prison and seeks revenge on his double-crossing partner. The mission is made difficult when the ex-con is strapped with the care of a young girl. Trouble is ahead for the pair and the hunter will become the hunted.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S2 E3 Tradition vs. Technology A routine job turns tough when the cowboys struggle to wrangle the herd across a highway, sparking Cody's idea to use GPS devices so they can easily find cattle in the pasture. Bubba hides a cow in the woods and Booger challenges Cody to prove GPS technology beats traditional methods. Misty and Kaley help Jaclyn find the perfect wedding dress while Bubba fails to fit into his tuxedo pants, prompting Booger and Cody to put him on a weight-loss regimen. Cody writes a song in honor of Booger's wedding and surprises Misty with a trailer for her new cattle business.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E6 Eight Hours to Die Corrupt Judge Burton seeks justice against those who are responsible for the hanging of his son, including Lucas McCain, who caught him. When Burton discovers that Lucas has a son, he captures Lucas to make him watch Mark suffer the same punishment.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E3 Seven A prison wagon carrying seven criminals stops in North Fork for supplies. The men escape, barricade themselves in the North Fork Saloon, and take saloon owner, Frank Sweeney, hostage. Lucas must act quickly to save Sweeney and the town from harm.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E5 Death Never Rides Alone A former gunfighter comes to North Fork with the intention of settling down and starting a new life. Many resent him but Lucas helps him. However, outlaws come to town and threaten to cause trouble with the retired gunman.

programme.title: The Gun and the Pulpit
programme.desc: The captivating tale of a smooth-talking gunslinger posing as a preacher to hide from his enemies. He ends up bringing hope to his parishioners and law-and-order to a town terrorized by crooks.

With science and courage, they survey their famous Mason-Dixon Line with pinpoint accuracy.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E17 The Road Not Taken Jimmy is hot on the trail of a killer that he has personal reasons for taking down. Jesse decides to tag along. Meanwhile, back at the station, the other riders are upset with Cody about a published story he wrote about them.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S2 E3 Badge Without Honor Gerald Eskith comes to town claiming to be a deputy marshal. He plans to take the Cartwrights' friend, Jason Blaine, to San Francisco to testify against the Murdock gang. Adam is suspicious and goes along with them.

programme.title: Shoot Out
programme.desc: A former robber is released from prison and seeks revenge on his double-crossing partner. The mission is made difficult when the ex-con is strapped with the care of a young girl. Trouble is ahead for the pair and the hunter will become the hunted.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S2 E3 Tradition vs. Technology A routine job turns tough when the cowboys struggle to wrangle the herd across a highway, sparking Cody's idea to use GPS devices so they can easily find cattle in the pasture. Bubba hides a cow in the woods and Booger challenges Cody to prove GPS technology beats traditional methods. Misty and Kaley help Jaclyn find the perfect wedding dress while Bubba fails to fit into his tuxedo pants, prompting Booger and Cody to put him on a weight-loss regimen. Cody writes a song in honor of Booger's wedding and surprises Misty with a trailer for her new cattle business.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E3 Seven A prison wagon carrying seven criminals stops in North Fork for supplies. The men escape, barricade themselves in the North Fork Saloon, and take saloon owner, Frank Sweeney, hostage. Lucas must act quickly to save Sweeney and the town from harm.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E5 Death Never Rides Alone A former gunfighter comes to North Fork with the intention of settling down and starting a new life. Many resent him but Lucas helps him. However, outlaws come to town and threaten to cause trouble with the retired gunman.

programme.title: Red Headed Stranger
programme.desc: Based on a Willie Nelson song, a spirited preacher and his wife come from the East to Montana to serve a country church. However, when overwhelming problems develop, the preacher must take revenge and attempt to save a town from a gang of cruel men.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E4 The Marshal Micah Torrance, formerly a famous marshal, who is now a drunk crippled from a gunfight, stumbles into North Fork. Lucas McCain hires him in hopes of rehabilitating the man. The good deed quickly backfires when outlaws arrive.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E9 The Last Trophy A wealthy British couple visits the Ponderosa. The wife soon finds herself attracted to the toughness of the Cartwright men. She begins to think her husband is a coward and sets her sights on attracting Adam.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S4 E2 Jim Beckwourth: The Long Ride Jim Beckwourth lives a life of adventure as a trapper, trader and adopted member of the Crow tribe. When America goes to war, Beckwourth becomes an army dispatch rider, a job that puts him and a young greenhorn on a collision course with the Pawnee.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E10 The Discoveries of George McJunkin After a devastating storm, ranch foreman George McJunkin finds ancient bison fossils and flint points unearthed in a riverbank, and he sets out to find someone in the scientific community who will acknowledge the importance of his discovery.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E2 Bass Reeves: A Father's Justice After a man murders his wife in a jealous rage and goes on the run, local lawmen are stunned when legendary Marshal Bass Reeves accepts responsibility for bringing the killer to justice...because the murderer is none other than Reeves' own son.

programme.title: Elkhorn
programme.desc: S1 E5 Desperate Measures Just as Theodore Roosevelt is finally getting his cattle operation up and running at Elkhorn Ranch, his health takes a turn for the worse, and his trusted ranch manager, Bill Sewall, must race to a Sioux village to find a cure before it's too late.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E23 The Second Witness Lucas' life is in danger after he agrees to testify in a murder case in another town. The only other witness was killed, and when a gun-toting stranger appears at the McCain Ranch, Lucas now finds himself in grave danger.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E24 The Trade Outlaw Sam Morley, an old friend, comes to the McCain Ranch. He asks Lucas to turn in him for the $500 reward and use the money to pay for his girlfriend's medical care. However, a bounty hunter has other ideas.

programme.title: McLintock!
programme.desc: A cattle baron awaits the return of his daughter from school and is surprised that his wife has returned to take their daughter away. He tries to keep the peace and do what is best for everyone.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E25 Which Way'd They Go? The Jackman clan must sell their farm to pay back taxes. The Jackmans were not much at farming so they move to a nearby town and take jobs as peace officers. When bank robbers confront them, Lucas must step in and help them deal with the outlaws.

programme.title: Legends of the Pony Express
programme.desc: Heroic Pony Express riders and station keepers face deadly terrain, hostile Native Americans, and dangerous outlaws to deliver vital mail across the untamed frontier. Their life-and-death adventures unite the country and become the stuff of legends.

programme.title: County Line: All In
programme.desc: The murder of a crooked lawyer on the county line forces two neighboring sheriffs to put aside their differences to take down the killer.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E12 Wilton the Kid A gunman known as Kid Vicious, who looks exactly like Captain Wilton Parmenter, arrives at Fort Courage. Wrangler Jane initially thinks he is the captain but after he terrorizes the F Troop, Parmenter shows his leadership and confronts the intruder.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E13 The Return of Wrongo Starr The jinxed cavalryman, Wrongo Starr, comes back to Fort Courage. However, this time he is making the F Troop very nervous with a load of dynamite in his possession. While there, he gets mixed up with a goat after Parmenter assigns him as a guard.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E21 Gathering Clouds Part 1 As tensions rise between the North and the South, the Army recruits the Kid to infiltrate a band of Southern rebel guerrillas led by a man known as the Hawk.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E6 Eddie's Daughter Eddie Halstead is a hotel clerk in North Fork. His daughter, Lillian, who he hasn't seen since childhood, arrives in town. She is now a dance hall girl and Lucas discovers criminals are following her, focused on the stolen money in her possession.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E7 Panic Lucas and Mark find a young couple in a wagon who are suffering from a fever. Lucas takes them to his ranch where a doctor confirms it to be yellow fever. No-good Brett Conway spreads the word in North Fork and panic sets in.

programme.title: Once Upon a Texas Train
programme.desc: An outlaw and a Texas Ranger have a life-long personal feud, but now, as grumpy older men, they must put their differences aside and face a common problem - a young gang of outlaws ravaging Texas.

programme.desc: A variety of religious speakers share different Christian doctrines and passages from the Bible alongside their reflections on them.

programme.title: The Incredible Journey
programme.desc: Archaeologist and pastor Gary Kent communicates the Gospel of Jesus Christ through fascinating stories of history and testimonies of people from different walks of life.

programme.title: Love Me: Ready Scripture Songs
programme.desc: Hosts Logan Parchamento and Lonnie Melashenko discuss the love of God through inspiring songs, stories and studies.

programme.title: Real Family Talk
programme.desc: Discussing family dynamics and sharing tools to strengthen marriages and families.

programme.title: Maranatha Mission Stories
programme.desc: Testimonies by people from various walks of life who have transformed their lives with help from Maranatha Mission volunteers.

programme.title: Lessons 4 Living
programme.desc: Lessons for navigating a spiritual journey.

programme.title: Bible Answers Live
programme.desc: The host sits down with religious leaders to discuss and answer questions about various aspects of life and faith using the Bible.

programme.title: Amazing Facts With Doug Batchelor
programme.desc: Many Christians say that the Ten Commandments were negated when Jesus died on the cross; discover what really happened when Jesus sacrificed His life, why He had to die, and what law actually passed away when He was crucified for your sins.

programme.title: Hope Sabbath School
programme.desc: A group of young adults participate in an in-depth and interactive study of the BIble while discussing a variety of topics.

programme.title: Hope at Night
programme.desc: Sharing life-changing stories from guests and challenging viewers with thought-provoking questions, calls to action and discussions about serious life topics.

programme.desc: At the end of the Civil War, Washington Wyatt (Danny Glover) is liberated from slavery and signs up as a sergeant in the first all African-American U.S. Army unit. programme.desc: Dave Harmon (Clint Walker) is the new sheriff in Yuma, Ariz., and he has his hands full as soon as he arrives. When Rol is killed in an attempted escape, Harmon is wrongly accused of shooting him, and the Kings' big brother, Arch (Morgan Woodward), will not stand for it. programme.title: Black Fox: The Price of Peace
programme.desc: Texas homesteader Delores Holtz (Cyndy Preston) is kidnapped by an Indian tribe, but refuses rescue when the opportunity comes. She falls in love with the tribe's chief, Running Dog (Raoul Trujillo), preferring him to her abusive husband, Ralph (Chris Wiggins). However, Ralph wants Delores back and plans a raid against the tribe to get her. Stuck in the middle, blood brothers Alan Johnson (Christopher Reeve) and Britt "Black Fox" Johnson (Tony Todd) must choose a side to fight for.

Left to fend for herself and her two children in the middle of nowhere, Evie strikes up a friendship with cowboy Conn Conagher (Sam Elliott), who passes by while she's working as a food server. And Conagher certainly can help, as the area is under constant threat of attack, be it from Apaches or local bandits.

After attracting the Renos' attention with a staged train robbery, Barlow gets in deeper when he strikes up a romance with their sister, Laura (Mala Powers). He gets roped back into active duty, though, upon learning that an enemy who Doron thought his unit had killed is still alive and plans on attending his brother's wedding. programme.title: Justice for All With Judge Cristina Pérez
programme.desc: A friend is blamed for a burglary after he leaves the front door unlocked; a man sues his date for lost wages after she causes him to be late for a job.

programme.title: Justice for All With Judge Cristina Pérez

programme.desc: A man accuses an acquaintance of stealing his autographed football while they were tailgating; a spurned woman sues her ex-boyfriend for lost wages.

programme.title: Justice for the People With Judge Milian
programme.desc: A grandmother is sued after using money left over from a root canal on a bathroom upgrade; a canceled hot air balloon ride ruins a family vacation.

programme.title: 2026 King of the Hammers
programme.desc: Only the strongest competitors and machines compete in this one-of-a-kind off-road race that requires both speed and survival to finish this true test of man and machine.

programme.title: Lost Classics
programme.desc: Tony helps prep a quirky, rare British TVR for sale and makes a play for one of the most elusive Camaros ever built, the legendary ZL1. When Tony is offered a rust-free '55 Chevy he knows it's a too good of a deal to pass up.

programme.title: My Classic Car
programme.desc: Host Dennis Gage upholds his "honor the timeless classics" catchphrase in this series, as he travels across North America to visit prestigious auto shows and events, spotlighting everything from muscle cars to museum pieces. The handlebar mustachioed Gage takes viewers along for the ride and keeps it entertaining with his unique perspective and enthusiasm for all things automotive.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: The Stunt Double is back in the shop for its reveal and payoff; inspired by the FALL GUY truck, the Stunt Double is a ground up, frame off build of a square body Chevy truck that pays tribute to the stunt world.

programme.desc: Sam and Doug prepare to start the 2024 Great Race.

programme.title: Shadow of a Doubt
programme.desc: (1943) Hitchcock thriller starring Joseph Cotten as a serial killer fleeing the law. Teresa Wright is his adoring niece who, initially, refuses to believe her uncle is a murderer.

programme.title: The Virginian
programme.desc: (1946) Western romance starring Joel McCrea and Sonny Tufts as a couple of cowboys who compete for the affections of a new schoolteacher from out east, played by Barbara Britton.

programme.title: Fixed Bayonets!
programme.desc: (1951) Korean War drama about the stress of battle. Officers drop one by one as a US platoon fights a rearguard action, leaving one unwilling man (Richard Basehart) to take their place.

programme.title: Anzio
programme.desc: (1968) Epic Second World War drama starring Robert Mitchum. A reporter gets trapped behind enemy lines during the costly 1944 Allied invasion of Italy. With Peter Falk and Robert Ryan.

programme.title: 10 Things I Hate About You
programme.desc: (1999) Teen comedy with Julia Stiles and Heath Ledger. A student is furious to discover her prom date was bribed by her sister to invite her. But confusion ensues when he falls for her.

programme.desc: (2016) Sci-fi blockbuster sequel starring Jeff Goldblum and Liam Hemsworth. Twenty years after Earth repelled a devastating alien invasion, the extraterrestrials return to finish the job.

programme.title: Bohemian Rhapsody
programme.desc: (2018) Rami Malek turns in an Oscar-winning performance as Freddie Mercury in this rollercoaster musical biopic of the late Queen frontman. Big tunes. Big drama. Bigger teeth.

programme.title: With or Without You
programme.desc: (1999) Couple Christopher Eccleston and Dervla Kirwin's relationship is tested when her former pen pal, Yvan Attal, turns up in Michael Winterbottom's drama. Strong language/sexual scenes.

programme.desc: The Trojan Bus: Classic 1970s police drama series. Regan and Carter investigate an art deal that is more than it seems, and ends up in a wasteground shootout. S2 Ep10

programme.title: Dempsey and Makepeace
programme.desc: Blind Eye: Classic detective series. Dempsey and Makepeace uncover a plot to murder Spikings while on an investigation to find a police informant's son who has been kidnapped. S1 Ep8

programme.title: Magnum, P.I.
programme.desc: Professor Jonathan Higgins: Classic US action drama series. Agatha hires Thomas to find out who took money from her ladies' club, and Higgins tries to refine a distant cousin of his. S5 Ep9

programme.title: Kojak
programme.desc: No Immunity for Murder: Classic US detective drama. Theo is convinced that the suspects in the murder of a book-keeper are innocent, but his attempts to prove it cause conflict. S3 Ep11

programme.title: Boon
programme.desc: Vallance's Liberty: Classic drama. Harry enlists Ken's help when an Austria-themed night at the Woodcote is used as a cover by a gang of criminals on the trail of hidden plans. S4 Ep4

programme.desc: Poppy: Violent criminal Vic Labbett returns to England to recover the proceeds of an earlier robbery, and Regan and Carter must stop him before he can get his hands on the loot. S2 Ep8
